title: [bug] exiting `yarn tauri dev` with ctrl+c crashes the powershell terminal
body:
### Describe the bug

This is different then the old ctrl+c bug where it rendered the terminal basically useless. This time it actually exits the terminal ðŸ˜… 

It happens only with yarn if your project uses beforeDevCommand (doesn't seem to matter which manager you use inside the command tho)

It seems to be a yarn@v1 specific problem, pnpm, npm, cargo all work fine (didn't test yarn2+)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30730186/165931849-a2098f9f-65b7-4f54-84d1-8d669516da6a.png)
Note that if you use powershell directly _instead of_ inside of MS Terminal it closes the whole window ðŸ¤· 

----
cmd.exe has a similar problem, but it doesn't crash or exit. Instead it just asks if i really want to close the dev process (twice?). Again, only with yarn. All good with pnpm etc.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30730186/165935203-21b06687-2ef3-495c-87f1-fe410de41461.png)
If you manage to insert a J/Y the terminal is completely fine again.

### Reproduction

1. run `yarn tauri dev`
2. close the app via ctrl+c (doing that before the app opens is enough)

_No response_
